column1: Our small businesses have been hit particularly hard this year.   This #SmallBizSat as you begin your holiday shopping remember to #ShopLocal and #ShopSafely -- wear a mask and social distance and consider making purchases online. https://t.co/ebKVzTFwqx
As #COVID19 cases in Colorado continue to rise it's so important to stay vigilant. Don't let up on what we know works.  #WearAMask #WashYourHands #SocialDistance https://t.co/0QIcUob0aI

Join us on Monday November 23rd at 5:00pm MST for a telephone town hall to hear updates on COVID-19 and the wildfires still burning in Colorado. Visit https://t.co/w915OV5tC5 for more information and to register. https://t.co/0OzRqTqi4K

I'm glad to see our proposal to help struggling small businesses earn bipartisan support in the Senate.   This legislation could save Colorado small businesses dealing with the impacts of COVID-19 up to $10000 in additional loan forgiveness. It is critical that we get this done. https://t.co/GeGGjU0QKI
Wear a mask. Social distance. Check in on your family and neighbors.   We will get through this but we have to work together. https://t.co/GGLiWHmteI

It's been 101 days since the House passed the #HeroesAct to fight COVID-19.   How many days must American families and frontline heroes go without desperately-needed support before Republicans in Congress are ready and willing to act?
Tune in live now I'm chatting with @RepJoeKennedy about coronavirus relief negotiations and direct cash assistance for Americans.   https://t.co/TuThqEGvWu https://t.co/SDbIVzdotZ

Firefighters working diligently to fight wildfires across Colorado are balancing dual crisis's as COVID-19 continues to spread.   Equipping our fire crews and expanding wildfire mitigation funds is essential. That's why I introduced the 21st Century Conservation Corps Act https://t.co/LWetskJwqn

Mask up Colorado! Wearing a mask is the easiest and most common sense thing we can do to protect our families neighbors & communities from #COVID19.   I'm challenging @RepJasonCrow @RepPerlmutter & @RepDianaDeGette to #WearAMask & help stop the spread. https://t.co/p6B4zopKly https://t.co/IfQV2uHTAE

Our states and cities are anticipating unprecedented and catastrophic budget shortfalls due to COVID-19.   Along w/ @RepJayapal @repmarkpocan & @reprashida I am urging the Federal Reserve to step up support for our struggling communities.    https://t.co/AyTm3yauel

Today we are launching our first-ever Virtual Job & Resource Fair to connect Coloradans to employers workforce experts trainings & to equip our community amidst incredibly challenging economic circumstances created by COVID-19.  Learn more at https://t.co/TQRXB8AiiN https://t.co/Gof0FbA4C4

Outdoor recreation in Colorado is responsible for 229000 jobs & $28B in spending.   Naturally Colorado's recovery from #COVID19 must include relief for our guides & outfitters solutions for our public lands & fire crews. That's why I've proposed a recovery plan for the west. https://t.co/9F3a02Gtjs

A great article on the incredible scientists and researchers here in the 2nd District at @ColoradoStateU who are working tirelessly to develop a #COVID19 vaccine. #FortCollins #CSU   https://t.co/MbIij9C8VW via @denverpost

My #COVID19 recovery plan would provide support for our mountain communities protect our public lands invest in our outdoor recreation economy employ Americans in conservation and equip our firefighters for wildfire season. We must get this done. https://t.co/BWJj5lKRyz
This World Refugee Day we celebrate all that refugees are doing in our communities to keep us strong and safe during COVID-19 and always.   #WRD2020 https://t.co/s7SaTl6MU0
Tune in now as @RepPressley and I discuss our work to safeguard our homeless population amidst COVID-19 https://t.co/TuThqEGvWu https://t.co/lRQMuDKYeS

We're bringing together mental health experts tomorrow to address and discuss the many stressors caused by COVID-19 from fear and loneliness to loss of a loved one and financial loss.  I hope you will join us tomorrow at 5pm MT: https://t.co/Ga6LofcDc3 https://t.co/CDxaY0Ar2D

It was a pleasure to serve at @CommFoodShare in Louisville today and visit w/ volunteers doing tremendous work to feed and resource our communities through #COVID19   Together @SenatorBennet and I are fighting to expand SNAP food security and ensure no Colorado family goes hungry https://t.co/lAxRu0NkhJ

Today I will be taking a moment of silence at noon to remember the over 100000 lives that have been lost in this country due to COVID-19. If you are able I ask that you join me and help keep the memories of those who have passed alive. #DayOfMourning

I'm grateful for the work of our @ColoradoStateU scientists to test workers and residents at nursing homes throughout our state.   Testing is critical and will help us stop the spread of #COVID19 and protect our vulnerable populations. https://t.co/xNUnNuRM2O

Senior living facilities in Colorado are particularly vulnerable to COVID-19 outbreak.   It is essential that we are providing sufficient and continuous PPE to these facilities to protect residents and staff.   See my letter to @FEMA ⬇️ https://t.co/Ub8bJjpyfA
Acompañe al congresista Joe Neguse a una asamblea pública telefónico. Comuníquese con nosotros para hacer sus preguntas acerca de COVID-19! https://t.co/51Bq15fzdS

Tonight we honor and remember the over 1000 Coloradans who we have lost to the novel coronavirus.   We are keeping the families friends and community members in our thoughts who have felt the tragedy of this unprecedented crisis so personally.

Those experiencing homelessness are more likely to be hospitalized or need critical care if they contract COVID-19 and lack of sanitation and shelter make them all the more vulnerable to being infected.

Those experiencing homelessness are particularly vulnerable to #COVID19. I am leading an effort along w/ @SenWarren @RepPressley & @RepRashida to call for robust homeless assistance in the next aid package https://t.co/2lb2maBR8i

Colleges and universities play a significant role in Colorado’s economy and #COVID19 has left them facing a financial shortfall of $274 million. We must ensure that our students and higher education institution are provided the relief they need survive this crisis. https://t.co/jA3GmYCwf8

The #COVID19 crisis like other crisis has left far too many ripe for exploitation. Myself @SenWarren @SenKamalaHarris & @RepTedLieu are calling for a prohibition on price gouging to be included in the next relief package to protect consumers and families during this crisis. https://t.co/M62JkjgYaA

Wildfire season amidst #COVID19 poises unique challenges for our firefighters.   We must ensure our fire crews have access to testing and that proper safety protocols are put in place to protect them during this time. https://t.co/FT3pRpBOCN

According to @WSJ Gilpin County Colorado is one of the hardest hit in the country by the #COVID19 pandemic.   This is why I introduced the Coronavirus #CommunityRelief Act to ensure that every city and county regardless of size can receive direct relief. https://t.co/lB08Bkonzu

It is essential that the first responders serving our community & firefighters preparing for wildfire season can access #COVID19 testing.   We asked @CDCgov to give first responders high priority testing status along with health care workers.  https://t.co/tR2zgXbjFk

The #COVID19 pandemic has exposed serious inequities in our health care system.   I'm incredibly grateful for @GovofCo's work to establish a Health Equity Response Team and I look forward to getting to work to address these disproportionate impacts. https://t.co/7F3rZCg3co

Direct federal funding to stabilize and equip our communities in Boulder County and elsewhere is essential.  We must swiftly pass the Coronavirus Community Relief Act and provide needed relief to every small town city and county in America.   https://t.co/1pV0VbWo92

#COVID19 has exposed the immense shortcomings of the Strategic National Stockpile.  Today alongside @RepVanTaylor I introduced bipartisan legislation to establish a commission to ensure we have proper oversight and are better prepared in the future. https://t.co/opPq2fpQyJ

Our homeless population is especially vulnerable to #COVID19. Shelter & sanitization are critical to combat the virus and yet far too many lack these essentials.   I've introduced legislation to provide $11.5 billion to support individuals without homes.   https://t.co/oQZ9FwV0hH

Protecting our first responders & firefighters is critical at this time. I've made that clear to the @VP & @CDCgov   Today we successfully secured updated guidance to provide first responders priority #COVID19 testing so they are not sidelined during this crisis. https://t.co/VBQbQhUMBl

Colorado emergency officials & King Soopers pharmacy will offer free #COVID19 drive-thru testing on the Auraria campus in Denver this week.  Tests will be administered on Tuesday & Wednesday from 10am to 4 pm at 650 Walnut St.  https://t.co/RSzXdYPIEy

THREAD: Small cities rural communities & counties across the U.S. are struggling economically amidst #COVID19.   We cannot abandon them. We must meet this moment and provide them needed relief.   That's why I'm proposing $250 billion in local stabilization funds. https://t.co/nZQramkUVP

This week more cities across the U.S. are laying off employees or discussing the need to because they simply cannot keep up with #COVID19 expenses and dried up sales tax revenues.   The next funding package from Congress MUST include funding for our cities and towns.

The next package from Congress MUST include funds for states and local governments including our smaller towns and rural counties.  My bill the Coronavirus #CommunityRelief Act proposes $250 billion to stabilize cities and counties with less than 500000 in population.

Advanced Urgent Care & Occupational Medicine in Broomfield is offering drive-thru COVID-19 testing.   To schedule an online assessment go to https://t.co/mxQOgngYMw or call 303-558-0509 to talk with a provider.  https://t.co/d3TZZBzRm3
Denver's National Jewish Health is now offering antibody testing for COVID-19. These tests are not free but available to anyone no doctor's note needed. https://t.co/2n4Bk0jI2M

The Coronavirus #CommunityRelief Act would ensure every city and town has the resources they need.   From Boulder Colorado to East Lansing Michigan to Kent Washington to Glen Allen Virginia to Farmington New Mexico to Oklahoma City and throughout the U.S.

Our focus has always been two-fold – problem-solving and leading locally.   As we experience the impacts of COVID-19 input from our district and from Coloradans has become that much more important. https://t.co/frX7Qbjo9d

I had the great pleasure of speaking with 200+ high school students from across our district during our virtual student town hall today and answering questions about my work in Congress and the COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/dgiJhwP6Zd

For individuals experiencing homelessness throughout the COVID-19 pandemic presents a unique set of challenges.   I've introduced a bill to provide robust support for those experiencing homelessness and the cities & organizations that support them. https://t.co/Mo0nkE5rP7

Thank you to Senators @MartinHeinrich @amyklobuchar and @SenBooker for joining me @repbenraylujan & 109 of my House colleagues in supporting our bipartisan Coronavirus Community Relief Act which will assist small cities and counties across the country! https://t.co/wereHh9Rcn

Cities and towns across America are expecting to experience considerable budget shortfalls due to #COVID19. We need #CommunityRelief for each and every one of them.   My bill would provide $250 billion local stabilization funds to ensure a full recovery. https://t.co/FKo31ve57K

As #COVID19 worsens our frontline postal workers remain vulnerable to the virus & our post offices require immediate support to maintain deliveries for customers who are quarantining  That's why I am proposing $25 billion for the U.S. Postal Service https://t.co/VyD3uXkXAF
We must enact universal vote by mail before the November elections to ensure everyone can vote safely and fairly amidst #COVID19

The #COVID19 pandemic is a battle & our nurses and doctors  are on the frontlines every day.   I am proposing a 25% salary increase in hazard pay for every front line health care worker to ensure they are compensated for the risks they are taking.   https://t.co/6YVtJIlQy6

I'm proud to earn the support and partnership of @SenWarren and @SenKamalaHarris on our effort to end price gouging amidst #COVID19   Protecting American consumers during this pandemic is critical and must be part of the next package from Congress  https://t.co/cQs7zGPFLK
Attorney General Barr's request for sweeping “emergency powers” amidst #COVID19 is deeply concerning.   Especially in times of crisis the rule of law must be maintained.   https://t.co/wMRJSApRWO

Amidst #COVID19 our local governments are hurting.   The Coronavirus #CommunityRelief Act proposes bold economic relief for every city & county in America to ensure that our communities can fully recover from this pandemic and prosper after it is over.  https://t.co/9ukwNEXNSY

Today I am introducing legislation w/ the support of @repbenraylujan @RepAndyLevin @RepMalinowski & 70+ of my colleagues to provide $250 billion in coronavirus stabilization funding to towns & counties across the United States.  We must meet this moment.  https://t.co/yeiDmn24CW

Firefighters police and first responders across our nation are on the frontlines of #COVID19 response and it is absolutely essential that they have access to coronavirus testing so they can continue to assist our communities   Read my letter to @VP and @CDCgov ⬇️ https://t.co/FhbhYTORbR

The FCC has received numerous reports of coronavirus-related robocall scams throughout this public health crisis.   We need federal enforcement from @FCC and @TheJusticeDept to protect millions of Americans particularly senior citizens who are being targeted with these scams. https://t.co/u2Ug7u9VAG

The #COVID19 pandemic has been costly on communities of every size.   Our cities towns and small counties need direct stabilization funding to recover from this public health crisis and prosper in the future.   https://t.co/MqTNpsbbHU

We must ensure food insecure families have flexibility & accessibility to utilize their SNAP and WIC benefits through #COVID19.   I am advocating for nationwide grocery delivery accessibility for SNAP benefits & the ability for beneficiaries to purchase basic household goods. https://t.co/0L9FZsXHn6
Yes! You are likely receiving a #coronavirus relief payment. Check your eligibility and how you’ll get the payment.👇  Have questions? Contact my office.   https://t.co/vvcFnn922E

We are working daily to ensure Coloradans have the relief and flexibility they need through #COVID19   Today I introduced 3 bills to:   📌end price gouging  📌ease restrictions on food security programs like SNAP & WIC 📌and prohibit debt reporting on #COVID19 medical costs. https://t.co/0dry1xYCMW

Communities across our district are in need of direct assistance to respond to the #COVID19 pandemic.  We must ensure that every community in Colorado has the needed-relief and funds to equip our communities and recover from this public health emergency. https://t.co/uKaoOmR0L9

It is imperative that we adapt the rules of food security programs like SNAP and WIC to meet the pressing realities of #COVID19 and ensure Coloradans can continue to feed their families through social distancing   https://t.co/YOQAkklh9Z

I’ll be hosting a telephone town hall tonight to answer your questions on coronavirus and the CARES Act that Congress just passed to provide funding for our families hospitals and small businesses.   Sign up to join us at 6:05pm tonight by visiting https://t.co/q4NINBLLPD https://t.co/IfJWEOHXRH

We continue to work with the @StateDept to get every American home who is navigating closed borders movement restrictions mandatory quarantines and canceled flights due to the #COVID19 pandemic  Thank you @JoyAnnReid for the opportunity to discuss. https://t.co/xGI8XFWwZL

I'm honored to assist @GovofCO in this endeavor & grateful to have secured these additional funds for our state https://t.co/KxIR6Ma2dd

In response to #COVID19 the VA is consolidating clinic usage and urging vets not to visit in-person unless requested by their provider. Vets can arrange for care here: https://t.co/cfKFs9br5b. If vets have flu-like symptoms or shortness of breath call (888) 336-8262 option 3.

The original version of the IDEA was enacted to ensure that all students with disabilities receive a free and appropriate public education.   We cannot fall short on this promise amidst #COVID19  Proud to support this initiative from @RepAngieCraig & @RepHuffman. https://t.co/74KCvLUwnS

We need the power of American manufacturing to get our healthcare professionals the supplies they need. I support the Medical Supply Chain Emergency Act to federalize our manufacturing efforts and beat the #COVID19 crisis once and for all.
